pullRequest.body:
Prove cliques have matchings exactly when they are even.

In preparation for Tutte's theorem.

---

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
This PR has diverged a little bit too much from main for my taste. I'll withdraw this and work on replacement PRs building on #18878

```suggestion
lemma isClique_even_iff_exists_isMatching [DecidableEq V] (u : Set V) (hu : Set.Finite u)
```
sounds more discoverable

```suggestion
  obtain rfl | h := u.eq_empty_or_nonempty
  Â· let empty : Subgraph G := {
```
is a nice pattern

Is that not just `âŠ¥`?
```suggestion
    let empty : Subgraph G := âŠ¥
```
Then you don't even need a `let`

```suggestion
protected lemma IsClique.completeGraph : (completeGraph Î±).IsClique s := by
```

```suggestion
lemma IsClique.even_card_iff_exists_isMatching [DecidableEq V] (u : Set V) (hu : Set.Finite u)
```

This result is still true if `u` is infinite: `Nat.card u = 0` is even and `u` contains a matching on `u`.
```suggestion
lemma isClique_even_iff_exists_isMatching [DecidableEq V] (u : Set V) (hc : G.IsClique u) :
    Even (Nat.card u) â†” âˆƒ (M : Subgraph G), M.verts = u âˆ§ M.IsMatching := by
```

I've adapted it to make room for it, but I'm not sure how to get there. The proof strategy for the finite case doesn't work, so I went looking for some sort of lemma about partitioning an infinite set into two infinite sets, but I can't find it. Any thoughts on how to approach this part?
With some help from @chrisflav and @Raph-DG I have a rough idea how to get there through `Cardinal`. I'll work that out soonish:)

pullRequest.title: feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): added matchings in cliques
